meanings.sent1: The siblings would often brabble over who gets to sit in the front seat of the car.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors would brabble loudly about whose turn it was to mow the lawn.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends would brabble playfully about which movie to watch next.
meanings.sent4: The birds outside seemed to brabble over the best spot to build their nests.
meanings.sent5: The children would brabble over who gets the last cookie in the jar.

meanings.sent1: The brabble between the two classmates disrupted the entire class.
meanings.sent2: The family's brabble could be heard from across the street.
meanings.sent3: The brabble at the town hall meeting was so loud that no one could hear the speaker.
meanings.sent4: The brabble of the seagulls over the fish scraps was a cacophony by the shore.
meanings.sent5: The brabble in the marketplace made it hard for customers to focus on shopping.
